name: Grevicor's Project Terrae (working title)
description:
A top-down RPG game in development with a procedurally generated world and (planned) online multiplayer for up to four players. The game will support features such as dungeon exploration, gathering materials, crafting, building shelters/houses, a story and so on.

 What you can do in the current version:
- start with gathering some wood, create a workbench and a pickaxe
- build a house
- enter a cave and gather some metals
- defeat skeletons to gather some crafting recipies
- craft better tools and armor

How to play:

Unzip the file and run ProjectTerrae.exe

Your progress is being saved automatically when you close the game (this is also the reason it takes a moment to close it)

Save data is located in User\AppData\LocalLow\Grevicor\ProjectTerrae

Generating the world and especially loading it is currently quite badly optimized, so the game may seem to freeze (maybe even for a few minutes on weaker hardware).

The game supports Mouse & keyboard and also ps4 and Xbox One controllers (PS5 and XSX controllers are likely to work too). Switch pro controller support is planned but right now it crashes the game :(

Mouse and keyboard controls:
W,S,A,D – walking
Left mouse button – using tools
E – Action button (entering houses, caves, opening chests)
I – opening/closing inventory (and chests)
Mouse wheel – selecting item

Gamepad controls:
Left stick/D-pad – walking
Right trigger – using tools
A - Action button (entering houses, caves, opening chests)
Y – opening/closing inventory (and chests)
X – Switching between crafting/equipment in inventory
Left/Right bumper – selecting item
